finalRecommendation.reason: Choose a seat on the **right** side of the aircraft. The breathtaking view of the Las Vegas Strip from the air at night is the premier visual event of this flight and decisively outweighs the views offered on the left.

bestViewingPeriods.description: Look for the massive, distant glow of the Chicago metropolitan area to the north.
A clear view of the Denver city lights on the plains before crossing the Rocky Mountains.
The key highlight: A brilliant and direct view of the Las Vegas Strip lighting up the desert.

specialHighlights: Distant view of Chicago's light dome
Exceptional stargazing over the Rocky Mountains and Arizona
Spectacular, direct view of the Las Vegas Strip
Expansive city lights on approach (better from left, but visible from right)

recommendation.reason: During departure from the NYC area, the flight heads west. A left-side seat offers the best potential to see the Manhattan skyline and the dense city lights of New York and New Jersey.
recommendation.specialCondition: Night flight. View is of city lights.

recommendation.reason: Flying over central Pennsylvania. Views will be limited to smaller towns and infrastructure. The left side looks south towards Harrisburg in the distance.
The flight path is crossing Ohio, south of the major cities along Lake Erie. A right-side seat may offer a distant view of the glow from Cleveland.
recommendation.specialCondition: Night flight. Views are of distant city glows.

recommendation.reason: Crossing Indiana and Illinois. The flight path passes well south of Chicago, making the right side the ideal choice for seeing the massive light dome of the Chicago metropolitan area.
recommendation.specialCondition: Night flight. View is of a very large, distant city.

recommendation.reason: The flight path crosses over Missouri, north of St. Louis but relatively close to Kansas City. The left side will provide a better view of the Kansas City metro area lights.
recommendation.specialCondition: Night flight over a mid-sized metropolitan area.

recommendation.reason: Flying over Kansas. The terrain is flat and sparsely populated. The flight path passes south of Omaha/Lincoln, so any distant glow would be on the right.
recommendation.specialCondition: Night flight over sparsely populated plains.

recommendation.reason: Approaching the Rocky Mountains and flying over Colorado. The flight path is south of Denver. A right-side seat will offer a clear view of the Denver-Aurora metropolitan area lights against the dark backdrop of the plains.
recommendation.specialCondition: Night flight with a major city view.

recommendation.reason: Flying over the Rocky Mountains in southern Colorado/northern New Mexico. This area is extremely dark, providing an excellent opportunity for stargazing from either side. The right side looks north towards more national parks and dark sky areas.
recommendation.specialCondition: Excellent stargazing opportunity due to low light pollution.

recommendation.reason: The flight path crosses northern Arizona, a region with significant dark sky preserves. The right side looks towards the Grand Canyon and southern Utah, offering spectacular stargazing.
recommendation.specialCondition: Prime stargazing segment of the flight.

recommendation.reason: This is the highlight of the flight. The path passes south of Las Vegas. A right-side seat is absolutely essential for a spectacular view of the brilliantly lit Las Vegas Strip and city in the middle of the dark Mojave Desert.
recommendation.specialCondition: Unobstructed view of the Las Vegas strip at night.

recommendation.reason: On approach to Los Angeles from the northeast. A left-side seat will provide an expansive view of the sprawling lights of the San Gabriel Valley and the greater Los Angeles basin as the plane descends.
recommendation.specialCondition: Night approach over one of the world's largest urban areas.
